issue.title: Tracking issue for libz blitz evaluation of reqwest

repository.name: reqwest
repository.description: An easy and powerful Rust HTTP Client

issue.body:
This is the tracking issue for the evaluation performed by the libs team this week.

- [x] [Expose RedirectAttempt and RedirectAction types](https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/issues/105)
- [x] [Hide trait impls that are inaccessible to users](https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/issues/106)
- [x] [Send and Sync in return type of Error::get_ref](https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/issues/107)
- [x] [Switch to &mut self builder](https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/issues/108)
- [x] [Move try_ macro to error.rs](https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/issues/109)
- [x] [Use realistic error handling in example code](https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/issues/110)
- [x] [Include an "Errors" section in documentation of functions that can return error](https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/issues/111)
- [x] [Decide how to handle JSON serialization errors](https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/issues/112)
- [x] [Comment why unwrap() won't fail](https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/issues/113)
- [x] [Include html_root_url attribute](https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/issues/114)
- [x] [Response doc improvements](https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/issues/115)
- [x] [Examples for the Body constructors](https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/issues/116)
- [x] [Error doc improvements](https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/issues/117)
- [x] [Example for RequestBuilder::headers](https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/issues/118)
- [x] [Examples for RequestBuilder::body](https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/issues/119)
- [x] [Conform to the recommended pattern for sealed traits](https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/issues/1194)
- [ ] [Reimplement StatusCode using associated constants](https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/issues/122)
- [ ] [Reimplement Method using associated constants](https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/issues/128)
- ~~[Stabilize some of the foundational types in a separate crate](https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/issues/1196)~~

issue.title: Add a Request type

repository.name: reqwest
repository.description: An easy and powerful Rust HTTP Client

issue.body:
When building a client API based on reqwest, I would often want to modify or inspect the private fields on `RequestBuilder`, namely method, url, headers and body.

Since they are private, you basically have to create your own builder and convert it, which is annoying.

What do you think about either making the fields public or providing getters/setters?

issue.title: Change RequestBuilder to return a Request, instead of using send() method?

repository.name: reqwest
repository.description: An easy and powerful Rust HTTP Client

issue.title: add ClientBuilder and custom TLS certs

repository.name: reqwest
repository.description: An easy and powerful Rust HTTP Client

issue.body:
Reopening #97 with edits. Specifically, the tests have been pulled out, since we can assume for now that the TLS library does what it says it does. Also updated the `ClientBuilder` to match the pattern in #108.

Closes #89

issue.title: New RequestBuilder implements builder with mutable reference which disallows code from docs to work

repository.name: reqwest
repository.description: An easy and powerful Rust HTTP Client

body: Hi @dtantsur! The API guidelines are always open to more insight, we've got [an open issue](https://github.com/rust-lang-nursery/api-guidelines/issues/81) there about `&mut self` builders where you could raise this.

issue.title: Change RequestBuilder methods to own a builder

milestone.description:
- Upgrade to hyper 0.12
- Other minor breaking changes...

repository.name: reqwest
repository.description: An easy and powerful Rust HTTP Client

issue.body:
This pull request is for 0.9.x branch, not master.

**Warning:** This is a breaking change, but this isn't 1.0.0 and the changes that will be required due to this change will likely be minimal for most usages (if there will be changes needed to begin with).

This means that `build` cannot possibly panic anymore due to being called multiple times. This is a breaking change as it breaks the behaviour of builder methods called without assigning to a new variable or chaining. It's rather easy to fix those usages, as they won't compile anymore and can be fixed by assigning a result.

Additionally, this change reduces the size of `RequestBuilder`, although this likely isn't all that meaningful, as usually there is no reason to store builders in structures.
